intro: Palaquium firmum, commonly known as the firmum palaquium or the red palaquium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy yellow flowers. Palaquium firmum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens.
